intro: Mesembryanthemum separatum, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with a distinctive central disc surrounded by ray florets. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
